name: The Ahwahnee

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in this magnificent hotel and could not have been more please. Valet service is the best I have experienced. Our room was large with a 40" flat screen TV and a nice view. We asked for a quiet room and that is what we got. Food was outstanding and of course the scenary of Yosemite national Park at your doorstep.
reviews.title: Wonderful Historic Hotel

reviews.text: My family and I wen't to California for a week-long vacation. We managed to reserve the last room at the historical Ahwahnee Lodge in Yosemite National Park. Driving down 120 to the park we got a phone call from the lodge. They had overbooked. Naturally we were devasted, this was to be the high point of our trip. The manager told us very appologetically that she would work something out. Five minutes later we got a phone call; everything was resolved, and without saying too much, The Ahwahnee went above and beyond.
reviews.title: Best Customer Service, Best Location

reviews.text: We arrived at the beautiful lodge after a hike down from Glacier Point. The gray, stacked rock, and wooden facade fit in naturally against the towering canyon walls, and sweet red ponderosa pines. The lodge, situated in the valley, has easy nature trails which wind through grassy, flowering meadows, and over gurgling streams.
reviews.title: Rooms very small and expensive, not very family friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior of the lodge features vaulted ceilings, and a rustic, yet simple eclectic style. Much of the furniture from the 1927 opening is still situated in the lodge. The grand piano which Judy Garland once tinckered on provides peaceful music to guests today. The Ahwahnee is a history book waiting to be opened and explored.
reviews.title: Over-rated and overpriced. Won't go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was amazed with the perfect juxtaposition of grandiose structure, and down-to-earth, relaxing environment. This is the perfect place to get away for a night, or for a week. We were taken care of like family by the staff, and were always greeted with friendly faces. I highly recommend going here whether for chilling out after a hard hike, escaping urban life, a family vaction, a honeymoon, or the place to write your next great novel. Just make sure you book early!
reviews.title: Beautiful common grounds- Room in need of update

reviews.text: I'll start by saying that the Ahwahnee is expensive. Almost everyone staying there complains about the price. Once you get past that little issue, we can talk about the hotel. The place is fabulous, quirks and all. Yes, the hotel only has one elevator for 6 floors. What can you expect from a hotel that was built in 1927? The public areas are grand and beautiful and the location is A++++! the grounds are fabulous and the staff will bend over backwards to help. Yes, it's expensive but, not hysterically so. I'd say by about 20%. even so, you'll need to book WAY in advance because everyone wants to stay there. Treat yourself and enjoy the view!
reviews.title: Grande Dame of Yosemite
A Once in a Lifetime 'Must-Do' for National Park Lovers
reviews.text: We were a bit hesitant of the steep $500/night pricetag here, but when a room opened up at the last minute for the first night of our Yosemite trip, we pounced on it. I'm so glad we did!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience started off on an extra high note when we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a room on the 5th floor with a balcony. It was a shared balcony with the room next door, but it was really more like a massive sundeck complete with patio furniture. No issues with the neighbors and the view looking out at Half Dome was truly unbelievable. We felt like we got a penthouse suite! (note - I think we got this because we have no kids. The balcony is likely a liability risk for anyone with young children).
reviews.title: Old world style in the heart of Yosemite

reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful. There was a pool and outside tables adjacent to the bar. The common rooms had a nice historical feel to them. Yes, it's an older hotel, but keep in mind this is still a national park lodge, folks. That's also why the price is so high -- I can't imagine what the cost must be to maintain such a place.
reviews.title: We loved it, especially for it's location and for the diningroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dining room is a very special experience. I liked that they have a dress code for dinner. Soaring ceilings, nothing but candlelight, even a piano player - simply a wonderful atmosphere! We've eaten in a lot of national park lodges and, to be honest, most of them don't have the greatest food. But the Ahwahnee far surpassed our expectations. Fantastic wine list and everything from appetizers to entrees to dessert was just delicious!
reviews.title: Tired and over priced - but a great location means I have to give it an extra point!

reviews.text: What a awesome view and location,maybe the best in the U.S.A. But the Ahwahnee cabins need more updating .The bathrooms were updated but thats about all,our cabin smelled of urine.There is a baby changing room and table that seemed to be the source of the smell.They need to rip up the carpet and throw out some of the old furniture.They can afford it at $500 dollars a night.COME MORE MANNNN. But we did not let it ruin our trip to this great National Park.
reviews.title: Awesome View and Location ,But

reviews.text: This hotel is not great. It's well located in the park, and the complimentary shuttle bus goes straight to the hotel, however the hotel is old and needs a bit of refurbishment. It seems to be the only proper hotel in the park, which means that they can charge what they want basically. We had requested connecting rooms and paid a premium to get them, however when we checked in we were not given them, the rooms were on opposite sides of the hotel! There is one elevator for the whole hotel (5 floors) which was incredibly slow, and could fir about 6 or 7 people in it. There was complimentary wifi access, but not many other perks.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: I would only reccommend this hotel for a short stay, just for the easy access to the park and convenient location. This is not a luxuary hotel, and located anywhere else it would easily be 30% of the price or less.
reviews.title: Its all about Location!

reviews.text: The good points - location, location, location, a beautifully situated hotel which looks lovely from the outside and duly historic inside. Great doormen, bell hops and reception staff very helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: Save your money!

reviews.text: The bad points - expensive for the size, quality and decor of the room, bed could be more comfortable, but I guess you are paying for the location and you know this before you book. We ate in the restaurant as it was my daughters birthday - the menu is extremely limited, expensive for what was offered and the quality of the food is average at best. The service is shocking! The serving staff assigned to our table exhibited dispositions totally unsuited to service. The restaurant looked beautiful when we arrived at 8pm, candlelit and buzzing - by 8.30pm it looked like a battleground, at least half the tables were empty yet remained covered in dirty food laden china and dirty glasses, we sat surrounded by this for over an hour, I can't believe it!
reviews.title: Fantastic location shame about the room

reviews.text: You have to give it credit for being so historic. The hotel was nice enough. The most noticeable problem with our room was a very ragged hem hanging out on the bedskirt. This could easily be fixed and do a lot for the room. The view was great. The hotel is overpriced, but there is nothing similar in close proximity. The restaurant is pretty good--it's an experience. It is very nice to go out on the back lawn after dark. You can imagine the hotel in its heyday, when all the fancy people came there!
reviews.title: Ahwahnee was pretty nice

reviews.text: Mildew growing on bathroom ceiling in room 210. Ceiling also looked as if there had been some leak from above and very hastily fixed. With tax the room was 419.00 per night, I wouldn't even pay 100.00 to stay at this so called first class hotel. Service from all staff members was less than professional or receptive. Ate dinner both nights at the restaurant and was less than remarkable. Host was rather rude both nights and wanted us to wait an additional 15 minutes past our reservation with over 10 empty tables at 9:15 pm. Would stay at the Lodge or a tent. I would rather take my chances with the bears.
reviews.title: Not even decent
Very disappointing
reviews.text: Expectations of any place can, at times, be too high. That being said, the Ahwahnee restaurant is a place you should avoid. We were hoping for someplace "special" to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and thought that we had found that place. We did not. If the Ahwahnee lived up to its snooty and supposed upper class atmosphere it could almost be forgiven, but it falls very far short of the mark. So many things were wrong with the service, the host, the waitstaff and the food that its difficult to find a place to begin. Maybe slipping the host a $20 dollar bill would have gotten one of the "special" tables by a window (several were open). Mentioning an anniversary celebration was not even returned with an insincere congratulations. First words out of the waiter's mouth were, "The specials tonight are...." Had to stop him right there and call him by the name on his badge by saying, "Good evening." for him and ask him "How he was doing this evening". The food, while overpriced, was average. It took nearly an hour to get the meal, had the feeling it was prepared ahead of time, and our plates sat in front of us a long time after we had finished. I don't mind paying top dollar if its worth it, but the Ahwahnee is a farce. Too high of expectations? Maybe, but then bad is bad no matter what your level of expectation. For a contrast and a profoundly different experience, drive the Tioga Pass to Whoa Nellie's Deli at the Mobil gas station in Lee Vining and experience the uniqueness that the Ahwahnee wishes it possesses. Yes the view is spectacular, but again, you shouldn't and do not have to pay for that at Yosemite. Avoid this place unless you need to tell someone that you ate at the Ahwahnee as a status thing.

reviews.title: over rated, but could be great
reviews.text: At $400.00 a night, we were there for 3 nights for a wedding and found the place to be visually wonderful outside and the bellmen were great, but the inside is more than a bit dated. I know it's old, but if your charging Ritz-Carlton rates, I would think they would clean it up more than just a little.

Dinner in the dining room was incredible, if you only like the view and enjoyd only so so dining expreience( 6 at the table and 8 more at the table behind us in our party, maybe they would get a clue, there was 30 in the total party).
reviews.title: Ahwahnee Cottages - Wonderful!

reviews.text: Great honeymoon spot if you get the right room - we had 417! A private balcony and huge views. The staff is not quite up to the price, but it's really about the location.
reviews.title: Get the right room and it's great!
Yosemite is awesome
reviews.text: We loved the dining room, the breakfasts and the dinner we had there were excellent. The location is superb surrounded by magnificent cliffs.

reviews.title: Definitely the Place to Stay in Yosemite
reviews.text: Now the negatives: the hotel is indeed way overpriced and although it does have a quaint old historical charm it isn't worth that amount. Room was okay, as stated elsewhere, fairly small, but we didn't intend spending much time in the room awake, just a place to lay the head at night. Arrival is a bit dark and gloomy, but we liked the reception area. We arrived at 10pm to be told the bar shuts at 10:30, so it was a quick drop off in the room and then down for a quick drink. The staff we encountered were all helpful, even down to suggesting some wine for us at dinner. One exception was one front desk person who seemed less than interested in trying to book us on a tour, thankfully a colleague stepped in to save the day and get us on the tour.
The park itself is magnificent and we long to return, hopefull in fall / winter to see it change. Our 2 days were far too brief and we could have stayed far longer exploring and hiking.
reviews.title: Smell The Coffee Guys!

reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the end of July. We had a corner room with a queen sized bed and a nice view. The location is one of the most beautiful settings in the world. The hotel is historic, impressive and while very expensive, is worth it. It certainly beats the alternative of Curry Village or driving from outside the park, though I would consider the Yosemite Lodge if I could get a reservation. The main dining room is one of the most impressive rooms I have ever eaten in with excellent service at dinner, though the food is a bit to rich for my tastes and is extremely expensive. We ate one night at the bar which was a comparative deal and gets its food from the same kitchen. Breakfast is served in the dining room and was good and has the same great view. They serve free tea for guests in the late afternoon. The tour of the hotel is free and is a good way to learn about the the history and architecture of the hotel. All in all, it is a very nice way to see Yosemite. We will go back, but I would like to go in the fall or winter when the park is not so crowded.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: The Ahwahnee had a wonderful location and is an amazing place to stay. Can be tricky to book but we have managed to get decent rates actually on the day. Right in the middle of Yosemite you can get to all the main trails from here. Rooms are decently sized if a bit dated. beds v comfortable. The restaurant room is enormous and memorable and the service very friendly. Breakfasts are particularly good. Bar food in the garden also quite good. pool is great after a days trail walking. It's expensive but is worth the expense for at least 1 night for the location.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ahwahnee is a beautiful hotel within Yosemite. Our room looked out towards Yosemite Falls. The room was clean and well appointed. One of the highlights of our stay was eating in the beautiful dining room. The Sunday brunch is huge!! Also, we had drinks outside on the rear patio, which also had great views. The rooms are pricey but worth the expense for a high class hotel inside the national park.
reviews.title: Relax in style at Yosemite National Park

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ahwahnee in Yosemite in June. It is a fabulous lodge, wonderfully decorated with many of the amenities of 5 star hotels. You really don't feel like you are in a National Park Lodge because it doesn't feel as old as most of them do. The only knock on the place is the cost. The rooms are very expensive as are the food and drink. But, you can't beat the location or the service! Yosemite itself is a beautiful National Park and it was especially nice this year with all of the snow pack from winter. The waterfalls were spectacular. If you can't afford to stay at the Ahwanhee, at least go there for a visit, it is something to see.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, but open your wallet!

reviews.text: We visited the Awhanee in July 2011 for lunch, having stayed here for a week in May 2006 to catch the spectacular spring waterfalls. After 5 years, nothing had changed and our initial impression remained the same: while the setting is exclusive and amazing, this hotel is a big disappointment. Relying primarily on its "historic charm," the Awhanee is pretentious, overrated, crowded, and -- frankly -- a boring place to stay or visit. We found nothing charming or cozy about the cottage we rented in 2006, and saw no improvements during our 2011 visit. Yes, we were right in the "heart" of Yosemite Valley, with all its attractions and traffic, but that only wore us down after a day or two, and the Awhanee offered no respite from the crowds, noise or activity. I was bored there with a 6yo and (later) an 11yo, who found nothing special or interesting about the property. If the expectations and hype weren't so great, I might not complain, but I'd hate to see anyone risk their summer vacation on the hope of an amazing stay at the Awhanee when that kind of experience seems so unrealistic to me.
reviews.title: Overrated, crowded, boring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The distinguishing feature of the Awhanee is the stunning communal areas - the great lounge is indeed a sight for the eyes. However, for the price it's a shame the bedrooms don't match up to the grandness of the ground floor areas. For $500 a night I expect rather more than a room I can hardly move around the bed in (and this was not basic standard room). The morning we left we ordered breakfast in the room as it was too early for the dining room to be open - room service never appeared - when I went down to reception (I was unable to phone from the room as the phone in the room didn't work, despite 3 requests for it to be fixed) I was told the room service person hadn't turned up for work. In its favor, we had no problem checking in slightly before the set time - despite other reviewers comments - and all staff we came across were very warm and helpful - particularly the concierge, who provided many useful tips and documentation on recommended hikes. My recommendation is to check out the lounge in the afternoon, enjoy a stroll in the grounds, take dinner there - the dining room at night really comes in to its own, with the addition of candles and a grand piano, but save on the cost of the room and let someone else contribute to the upkeep of the place. The place gets booked out a year in advance so there's clearly no incentive to lower the price or undertake a refit to bring the rooms up to the standard people are entitled to expect for the price - a shame, as if over time customers start to kick back and the Awhanee falls on hard times, an icon would be lost from the National Park's portfolio.
reviews.title: For the price you deserve more
Just loved the Ahwahnee
reviews.text: We just loved this hotel although it is a bit pricey. The service is excellent but low key so if you don't need anything you won't be bothered. Our room was great with a view of the waterfall. The Dining Room is an experience that you must do. Never mind the views, the room itself is beautiful and the food excellent. We stayed there 2 nights and we totally enjoyed our stay there

We arrived at The Ahwahnee in the afternoon prior to the actual published check-in time. The people at the registration desk were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was ready for us, even though we were early. The room was beautiful--very clean and comfortable with a delightful decor. The view of the mountains was breathtaking! We stayed four nights and enjoyed every facet of the hotel and the valley. The restaurant meals were delicious and amply satisfying. The service was impeccable. All personnel--restaurant, gift shop, housekeeping, front desk--were gracious, accommodating and very personable. One highlight was an error made by the concierge in signing us up for a tour of the hotel on a day the tour was not scheduled. She went out of her way to find a knowledgeable employee who took us on a personal guided tour of the hotel facilities. The shuttle service into town from The Ahwahnee was outstanding. Considering the price of the room, we were expecting first class service and accommodations in an outstanding location. We were not disappointed. We would highly recommend The Ahwahnee, for one is not paying merely for a hotel room, but for the ambience of the location, architecture and the historical landmark of this outstanding facility.
reviews.title: The Ahwahnee Exceeded our Expectations

reviews.text: Stayed one night at the Ahwahnee and loved it. It is a nice property but over priced at $400 per night. Still, it is a historic property and worth the stay for one night! The next night we stayed at Yosemite Lodge for about $160 which is bit more reasonable. The trip to Yosemite was our first and we were not disappointed. We were a bit surprised to find mosquitoes there! They were vicious!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but over priced
Love Yosemite
reviews.text: My husband and I have visited Yosemite at least annually in late January early February. In 1975, our first visit there together, all we could afford was Curry Village. Over the years we have worked our way up to a suite at the Ahwahnee. This January we were booked into "The Queen's Suite" (The Mary Curry Tressidor Room), so called because Queen Elizabeth II stayed in the room when she visited the Park. We expected luxury. What we found was that the room was in sad disrepair. The upholstery on the guest chairs in the room was worn and frayed. The chairs themselves were so low that we had to add pillows to the seats in order to be comfortable. It was the largest bathroom we have encountered on any trip, anywhere, but the sink and counter were uncomfortably low for me at 5'3" and very low for my 6'2" husband. The biggest disappointment was that the room was called, and priced as, a SUITE when in fact it was a room with a bath like most of the rooms in the hotel. We were there for a 3 night stay. After our 2nd night in the room we asked to be changed to other accomadations which the staff accomplished with grace and speed. Five stars for the staff, 1-2 stars for the accomadations booked. The current management has removed a lot of the amenities and pleasure from a stay at the Ahwahnee, but we will return.

reviews.title: 5 star setting; 3 star service
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ahwahnee for one night. We got a 4 star room, in a 5 star setting, with 3 star service. We had a nice room with a large deck from which we could view Yosemite Falls--spectacular. But, our room wasn't ready at 4:00, there was a maintenance problem in the room and no evidence that they worked on it, and they scheduled work on the deck so we "enjoyed" it while work was going on. So, no disaster, but not up to the standards one would expect from a hotel with its image.
First, we will definitely come back here. Not because it's great hotel but because the location is so fantastic.
reviews.title: Time to reinvest.....
Terrible - needs new management urgently
reviews.text: I think we would agree with most other people that the Ahwahnee offers poor value for money and it is probably time the management began to reinvest some of the profits from this enterprise. But with a hotel that is fully booked all year round - in spite of its obvious and documented faults - why would they bother?

We were dismayed by the rather dreary bathroom with its 1960s/70s fittings - surely that's not what they mean by 'historic'. Our room was also right above the bar and we got a lot of noise from the patio until late into the evening - after midnight on one occasion. Some of the staff also seemed to take the attitude that they were doing you a favour by letting you stay there, which is kind of unhelpful.
reviews.title: Seems as though we were lucky !
sun porch room
reviews.text: The dining room is overpriced for the quality of the food and can get a bit cold and draughty, even in September. We found the food in the bar to be OK - though the service can be a bit haphazard.

In all an OK experience but I think it's time for the Parks service to either outsource the management of this place to a professional (and successful) hotel group, or dig deep and make the investment that is sorely needed.
reviews.title: Ahwahnee a nice experience but overrated

aka: The Ahwahnee Hotel Yosemite National Park
description: Tuesday August 27, 2013 - With the exception of White Wolf Lodge, all lodging and services are available in Yosemite National Park. Yosemite Valley and Wawona are largely unaffected by the Rim Fire and air quality is good.
